alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 20 at 2:46PM AKST until January 22 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM SUNDAY TO 7 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. North-northeast winds 15 to 25 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley. * WHEN...From 7 PM Sunday to 7 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A cold Arctic trough is dragging a very cold air mass out of the northeast tonight through Monday. Paired with higher winds, wind chills are expected drop between -40F to -50F Sunday night through Monday. Wind chills -25F to -35F are expected tonight and Monday night as well. Winds will begin diminishing overnight Monday.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
